File: vsip/core/vector.hpp
  1/* Copyright (c) 2005 by CodeSourcery, LLC.  All rights reserved. */
  2
  3/** @file    vsip/core/vector.hpp
  4    @author  Zack Weinberg
  5    @date    2005-01-24
  6    @brief   VSIPL++ Library: [view.vector] views implementing
  7             one-dimensional vectors.
  8
  9    This file declares the \c const_Vector and \c Vector classes,
 10    which provide the generic View interface, and implement the
 11    mathematical idea of vectors, i.e. one-dimensional storage and
 12    access to values.  A \c const_Vector view is not modifiable, but a
 13    \c Vector view is modifiable.  */
 14
 15#ifndef VSIP_CORE_VECTOR_HPP
 16#define VSIP_CORE_VECTOR_HPP
 17

 19  Included Files
 20***********************************************************************/

 26#include <vsip/core/subblock.hpp>
 27#include <vsip/core/expr/scalar_block.hpp>
 28#include <vsip/core/refcount.hpp>
 29#include <vsip/core/noncopyable.hpp>
 30#include <vsip/core/view_traits.hpp>
 31#include <vsip/core/assign.hpp>
 32#include <vsip/core/lvalue_proxy.hpp>
 33#include <vsip/core/block_fill.hpp>
 34#include <vsip/core/expr/evaluation.hpp>

 37  Declarations
 38***********************************************************************/

 40namespace vsip
 41{
 42
 43/// View which appears as a one-dimensional, read-only vector.
 44template <typename T, typename Block>
 45class const_Vector : public impl::Non_assignable,
 46		     public vsip::impl_const_View<vsip::const_Vector,Block>
 47{
 48  typedef vsip::impl_const_View<vsip::const_Vector,Block> impl_base_type;
 49  typedef typename impl::Lvalue_factory_type<Block>::type impl_factory_type;
 50
 51public:
 52  // Compile-time values.
 53  static dimension_type const dim = 1;
 54  typedef Block                                       block_type;
 55  typedef typename block_type::value_type             value_type;
 56  typedef typename impl_factory_type::reference_type  reference_type;
 57  typedef typename impl_factory_type::const_reference_type
 58		const_reference_type;
 59
 60protected:
 61  typedef typename block_type::map_type  impl_map_type;
 62  typedef impl::Subset_block<block_type> impl_subblock_type;
 63
 64public:
 65  // [view.vector.subview_types]
 66  typedef const_Vector<T, impl_subblock_type> subview_type;
 67  typedef const_Vector<T, impl_subblock_type> const_subview_type;
 68
 69  typedef typename impl_base_type::impl_const_view_type impl_const_view_type;
 70
 71  // [view.vector.constructors]
 72
 73  const_Vector(length_type len, T const& value,
 74	       impl_map_type const& map = impl_map_type())
 75    : impl_base_type(new block_type(Domain<1>(len), value, map),
 76		     impl::noincrement)
 77  {}
 78  explicit const_Vector(length_type len,
 79			impl_map_type const& map = impl_map_type())
 80    : impl_base_type(new block_type(Domain<1>(len), map), impl::noincrement)
 81  {}
 82  const_Vector(Block& blk) VSIP_NOTHROW
 83    : impl_base_type (&blk)
 84  {}
 85  const_Vector(const_Vector const& v) VSIP_NOTHROW
 86    : impl_base_type(&v.block())
 87  { impl::expr::evaluate(this->block());}
 88  ~const_Vector() VSIP_NOTHROW
 89  {}
 90
 91  // [view.vector.valaccess]
 92  value_type get(index_type i) const VSIP_NOTHROW
 93  {
 94    assert(i < this->size(0));
 95    return this->block().get(i);
 96  }
 97
 98  // Supported for some, but not all, underlying Blocks.
 99  const_reference_type operator()(index_type i) const VSIP_NOTHROW
100  {
101    assert(i < this->size(0));
102    impl_factory_type f(this->block());
103    return f.impl_ref(i);
104  }
105
106  // [view.vector.subviews]
107  const_subview_type
108  get(Domain<1> const& dom) const VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc))
109  {
110    impl_subblock_type block(dom, this->block());
111    return const_subview_type(block);
112  }
113  const_subview_type
114  operator()(Domain<1> const& dom) const VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc))
115  {
116    impl_subblock_type block(dom, this->block());
117    return const_subview_type(block);
118  }
119
120  // [view.vector.accessors]
121  length_type length() const VSIP_NOTHROW
122    { return this->block().size(); }
123};
124
125
126
127#define VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_SCALAR(op)        		   \
128  *this = *this op val
129
130#define VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_SCALAR_NOFWD(op)			   \
131  for (index_type i = 0; i < this->size(); i++)			   \
132    this->put(i, this->get(i) op val)
133
134#define VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_VECTOR(op)	                   \
135  *this = *this op v;
136
137#define VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_VECTOR_NOFWD(op)			   \
138  for (index_type i = (assert(this->size() == v.size()), 0);	   \
139       i < this->size(); i++)					   \
140    this->put(i, this->get(i) op v.get(i))
141  
142#define VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP(asop, op)			   	   \
143  template <typename T0>                                           \
144  Vector& operator asop(T0 const& val) VSIP_NOTHROW                \
145  { VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_SCALAR(op); return *this;}               \
146  template <typename T0, typename Block0>                          \
147  Vector& operator asop(const_Vector<T0, Block0> v) VSIP_NOTHROW  \
148  { VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_VECTOR(op); return *this;}               \
149  template <typename T0, typename Block0>                          \
150  Vector& operator asop(const Vector<T0, Block0> v) VSIP_NOTHROW  \
151  { VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_VECTOR(op); return *this;}
152
153#define VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP_NOFWD(asop, op)			   \
154  template <typename T0>                                           \
155  Vector& operator asop(T0 const& val) VSIP_NOTHROW                \
156  { VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_SCALAR_NOFWD(op); return *this;}	   \
157  template <typename T0, typename Block0>                          \
158  Vector& operator asop(const_Vector<T0, Block0> v) VSIP_NOTHROW   \
159  { VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_VECTOR_NOFWD(op); return *this;}	   \
160  template <typename T0, typename Block0>                          \
161  Vector& operator asop(const Vector<T0, Block0> v) VSIP_NOTHROW   \
162  { VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_VECTOR_NOFWD(op); return *this;}
163
164
165/// View which appears as a one-dimensional, modifiable vector.  This
166/// inherits from const_Vector, so only the members that const_Vector
167/// does not carry, or that are different, need be specified.
168template <typename T, typename Block>
169class Vector : public vsip::impl_View<vsip::Vector,Block>
170{
171  typedef vsip::impl_View<vsip::Vector,Block> impl_base_type;
172  typedef typename impl::Lvalue_factory_type<Block>::type impl_factory_type;
173
174public:
175  // Compile-time values.
176  static dimension_type const dim = 1;
177  typedef Block                                      block_type;
178  typedef typename block_type::value_type            value_type;
179  typedef typename impl_factory_type::reference_type reference_type;
180  typedef typename impl_factory_type::const_reference_type
181		const_reference_type;
182
183private:
184  // Implementation compile-time values.
185  typedef typename block_type::map_type             impl_map_type;
186
187  // [view.vector.subview_types]
188  // Override subview_type and make it writable.
189  typedef impl::Subset_block<block_type> impl_subblock_type;
190
191public:
192  typedef Vector<T, impl_subblock_type>      subview_type;
193
194  // [view.vector.constructors]
195  Vector(length_type len, T const& value,
196	 impl_map_type const& map = impl_map_type())
197    : impl_base_type(len, value, map, impl::disambiguate)
198  {}
199  explicit Vector(length_type len,
200	          impl_map_type const& map = impl_map_type())
201    : impl_base_type(len, map)
202  {}
203  Vector(Block& blk) VSIP_NOTHROW
204    : impl_base_type(blk)
205  {}
206  Vector(Vector const& v) VSIP_NOTHROW
207    : impl_base_type(v.block())
208  { impl::expr::evaluate(this->block());}
209  template <typename T0, typename Block0>
210  Vector(const_Vector<T0, Block0> const& v) VSIP_NOTHROW
211    : impl_base_type(v.length(), v.block().map())
212  { *this = v; }
213  ~Vector() VSIP_NOTHROW
214  {}
215
216  // [view.vector.valaccess]
217  void put(index_type i, value_type val) const VSIP_NOTHROW
218  {
219    assert(i < this->size(0));
220    this->block().put(i, val);
221  }
222
223  reference_type operator()(index_type i) VSIP_NOTHROW
224  {
225    assert(i < this->size(0));
226    impl_factory_type f(this->block());
227    return f.impl_ref(i);
228  }
229
230  template <typename T0, typename Block0>
231  Vector(Vector<T0, Block0> const& v)
232    : impl_base_type(v.size(), impl_map_type())
233  { *this = v; }
234
235  Vector& operator=(Vector const& v) VSIP_NOTHROW
236  {
237    assert(this->size() == v.size());
238    impl::assign<1>(this->block(), v.block());
239    return *this;
240  }
241
242  Vector& operator=(const_reference_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW
243  {
244    impl::expr::Scalar<1, T> scalar(val);
245    impl::assign<1>(this->block(), scalar);
246    return *this;
247  }
248  template <typename T0>
249  Vector& operator=(T0 const& val) VSIP_NOTHROW
250  {
251    impl::expr::Scalar<1, T0> scalar(val);
252    impl::assign<1>(this->block(), scalar);
253    return *this;
254  }
255  template <typename T0, typename Block0>
256  Vector& operator=(const_Vector<T0, Block0> const& v) VSIP_NOTHROW
257  {
258    assert(this->size() == v.size());
259    impl::assign<1>(this->block(), v.block());
260    return *this;
261  }
262  template <typename T0, typename Block0>
263  Vector& operator=(Vector<T0, Block0> const& v) VSIP_NOTHROW
264  {
265    assert(this->size() == v.size());
266    impl::assign<1>(this->block(), v.block());
267    return *this;
268  }
269  template <typename T0, typename Block0>
270  Vector &operator=(impl::lazy_Vector<T0, Block0> const &v) VSIP_NOTHROW
271  {
272    assert(this->size() == v.size());
273    impl::assign<1>(this->block(), v.block());
274    return *this;
275  }
276
277  // [view.vector.subviews]
278  subview_type
279  operator()(Domain<1> const& dom) VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc))
280  {
281    impl_subblock_type block(dom, this->block());
282    return subview_type(block);
283  }
284
285  // [view.vector.assign]
286  VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP(+=, +)
287  VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP(-=, -)
288  VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP(*=, *)
289  VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP(/=, /)
290  // ghs claims the use of operator& in 'view1 & view2' is ambiguous,
291  // thus we implement operator&= in terms of the scalar operator&.
292  // Likewise for operator=| and operator=^.
293  VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP_NOFWD(&=, &)
294  VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP_NOFWD(|=, |)
295  VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP_NOFWD(^=, ^)
296
297};
298
299#undef VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP
300#undef VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_SCALAR
301#undef VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_VECTOR
302#undef VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP_NOFWD
303#undef VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_SCALAR_NOFWD
304#undef VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_VECTOR_NOFWD
305
306namespace impl
307{
308
309template <typename T, typename Block>
310class lazy_Vector : public const_Vector<T, Block>
311{
312public:
313  lazy_Vector(Block &b) VSIP_NOTHROW : const_Vector<T, Block>(b) {}
314  // lazy copy: don't evaluate.
315  lazy_Vector(lazy_Vector const &v) : const_Vector<T, Block>(v.block()) {}
316};
317
318} // namespace vsip::impl
319
320
321// [view.vector.convert]
322template <typename T, typename Block>
323struct ViewConversion<Vector, T, Block>
324{
325  typedef impl::lazy_Vector<T, Block> lazy_view_type;
326  typedef const_Vector<T, Block> const_view_type;
327  typedef Vector<T, Block> view_type;
328};
329
330template <typename T, typename Block>
331struct ViewConversion<const_Vector, T, Block>
332{
333  typedef impl::lazy_Vector<T, Block> lazy_view_type;
334  typedef const_Vector<T, Block> const_view_type;
335  typedef Vector<T, Block> view_type;
336};
337
338template <typename T, typename Block>
339struct ViewConversion<impl::lazy_Vector, T, Block>
340{
341  typedef impl::lazy_Vector<T, Block> lazy_view_type;
342  typedef const_Vector<T, Block> const_view_type;
343  typedef Vector<T, Block> view_type;
344};
345
346namespace impl
347{
348
349template <typename T,
350	  typename Block>
351struct View_of_dim<1, T, Block>
352{
353  typedef Vector<T, Block>       type;
354  typedef const_Vector<T, Block> const_type;
355};
356
357template <typename T, typename Block> 
358struct Is_view_type<Vector<T, Block> >
359{
360  typedef Vector<T, Block> type;
361  static bool const value = true;
362};
363
364template <typename T, typename Block> 
365struct Is_view_type<const_Vector<T, Block> >
366{
367  typedef const_Vector<T, Block> type;
368  static bool const value = true;
369};
370
371template <typename T, typename Block> 
372struct Is_view_type<impl::lazy_Vector<T, Block> >
373{
374  typedef impl::lazy_Vector<T, Block> type;
375  static bool const value = true;
376};
377
378template <typename T, typename Block> 
379struct Is_const_view_type<const_Vector<T, Block> >
380{
381  typedef const_Vector<T, Block> type;
382  static bool const value = true;
383};
384
385template <typename T, typename Block>
386T
387get(const_Vector<T, Block> view, Index<1> const &i)
388{
389  return view.get(i[0]);
390}
391
392template <typename T, typename Block>
393void
394put(Vector<T, Block> view, Index<1> const &i, T value)
395{
396  view.put(i[0], value);
397}
398
399/// Return the view extent as a domain.
400template <typename T,
401	  typename Block>
402inline Domain<1>
403view_domain(const_Vector<T, Block> const& view)
404{
405  return Domain<1>(view.size(0));
406}
407
408/// Get the extent of a vector view, as a Length. 
409template <typename T,
410	  typename Block>
411inline Length<1>
412extent(const_Vector<T, Block> v)
413{
414  return Length<1>(v.size(0));
415}
